title: US sinks another $2.1 billion into a potential vaccine
author: DANICA KRKA Associated Press
description: LONDON (AP) — Pharma giants GlaxoSmithKline and Sanofi Pasteur have announced they will supply 100 million doses of its experimental COVID-19vaccine to the United States as governments buy up supplies in hopes of securing a candidate that works. The United States will pay up to $2. 1 billion "for development including clinical trials, manufacturing, scale-up and delivery" of the vaccine, the two companies based in Europe said in a statement.
